page.title: 04An Elderly People's Home
page.content: We visited Carybrook, an elderly people's home in Castle Cary, with a question sheet & tape-recorder. We interviewed three people about themselves:- One man used to work in a joinery shop on Bailey Hill, but came to Carybrook because he became too old to look after himself. He said he enjoyed the scenery and wouldn't move for any reason. One woman had lived in Cary all her life, and said she liked all the area, and wouldn't leave. She told us there was once a cheese factory in Cary, and enjoyed talking about the town. Another woman had been in the home for 4 years, and had come for family reasons. She liked the area, but didn't know it very well, as she couldn't get about much.
